definitions: ceremonial invocation of divine blessing typically given at the end of religious service
examples: The priest gave the final benediction before dismissing the congregation
She raised her hands in benediction over the newlyweds

definitions: person who gives money or other help to support a person or cause
examples: The anonymous benefactor donated millions to build the new hospital
She became a benefactor to several young artists struggling to make ends meet

definitions: person who derives advantage from something especially a trust will or insurance policy
examples: The children were named as beneficiaries in their grandmother's will
All beneficiaries of the scholarship program must maintain good grades

definitions: disposition to do good and act with kindness toward others showing genuine concern
examples: The king was known for his benevolence toward the poor subjects
Her benevolence extended to all creatures great and small alike

definitions: particular talent tendency or inclination especially a strong natural interest
examples: She had a bent for mathematics from an early age
His artistic bent showed in everything he created

definitions: colorless volatile liquid hydrocarbon present in coal tar and petroleum used in chemical synthesis
examples: Benzene is used in manufacturing plastics and synthetic fibers
The chemist warned about benzene exposure in the laboratory

definitions: something left to someone in a will especially money or property
examples: Her bequest to the museum included several valuable paintings
The university received a substantial bequest from the alumnus

definitions: act of criticizing or scolding someone angrily and at length
examples: The coach's berating of the team lasted for twenty minutes
She endured his berating in silence before walking away

definitions: person who has recently lost a close relative or friend through death
examples: The bereaved gathered at the funeral home to pay respects
Support groups help the bereaved cope with their profound loss

definitions: state of sorrow over the death of someone loved involving grief and mourning
examples: She took bereavement leave after her father passed away suddenly
The counselor specialized in helping people through bereavement and grief

definitions: round flat cap made of soft material without a brim or peak
examples: The artist wore a black beret tilted at an angle
French soldiers traditionally wear berets as part of their uniform

definitions: large mass of ice floating in the sea or a mountain especially in place names
examples: The ship carefully navigated around the massive berg ahead
They climbed the berg despite warnings about dangerous conditions

definitions: flat strip of land raised bank or terrace beside a road or waterway
examples: Workers built a berm to prevent flooding along the river
The highway berm was covered with wildflowers in spring season

definitions: small roundish juicy fruit without a stone typically eaten fresh
examples: She picked fresh berries from the bushes behind her house
The pie was filled with sweet berries and topped with cream

definitions: ancient Norse warrior who fought with frenzied rage in battle displaying wild fury
examples: The berserker charged into battle without armor or fear
He fought like a berserker when his family was threatened

definitions: fixed bunk on a ship or train for sleeping
space at a wharf for a ship to dock
examples: She booked an upper berth for the overnight train journey
The captain reserved a berth at the busy harbor
The cruise ship found a berth at the crowded port
They gave him a wide berth after his angry outburst

definitions: transparent precious stone of various colors especially green blue or yellow varieties
examples: The jeweler showed her a ring with a pale beryl stone
Emerald is actually a green variety of beryl mineral

definitions: lightweight metallic chemical element used in alloys and nuclear reactors with atomic number four
examples: Beryllium is used in aerospace materials for its strength
The technician handled beryllium with extreme caution and protective gear

definitions: act of surrounding a place with armed forces to capture it or force surrender
examples: The besieging of the castle lasted for three long months
Historical accounts describe the besieging of ancient cities in detail

definitions: behavior that is very cruel or like that of an animal lacking human qualities
examples: The bestiality of the attack shocked even hardened investigators
War can bring out bestiality in otherwise civilized people

definitions: medieval book describing real and mythical animals often with moral lessons included
examples: The illuminated bestiary contained fantastic creatures and moral tales
Medieval bestiaries mixed natural history with religious symbolism

definitions: book or other product that sells in very large numbers
examples: Her debut novel became an unexpected bestseller within months
The bookstore prominently displayed all the current bestsellers

definitions: second letter of the Greek alphabet
preliminary version of software released for testing
examples: In the equation, beta represents the second variable
Students learned alpha and beta in Greek class
The company released the beta version to selected testers
Users reported several bugs in the beta software

definitions: climbing plant whose leaves are chewed as a mild stimulant in Asia
examples: Vendors sold betel leaves wrapped with areca nut at markets
Chewing betel is a traditional practice in many Asian cultures

definitions: act of betraying someone or something involving broken trust and deception
examples: His betrayal of their friendship hurt more than anything else
The spy's betrayal endangered the lives of many agents

definitions: formal agreement to marry someone involving mutual promise between two people
examples: The betrothal ceremony was attended by both families
Their betrothal was announced in the society pages

definitions: person who is engaged to be married to someone
examples: He introduced his betrothed at the family gathering
The betrothed couple planned their wedding for next spring

definitions: act or process of improving something or making it better
examples: She devoted her life to the betterment of society
The program focused on betterment of working conditions for employees

definitions: surface or edge cut at an angle other than ninety degrees
examples: The carpenter cut a bevel on the wood for joining
The mirror had an elegant bevel around its edges

definitions: any drink especially one other than water including hot and cold liquids
examples: The restaurant offered a wide selection of beverages
Coffee remains the most popular morning beverage for many people

definitions: feeling of being perplexed and confused unable to understand what is happening
examples: She looked around in complete bewilderment at the chaos
His bewilderment grew as the situation became more complicated

definitions: grooved ring or rim holding a gem watch crystal or similar object in place
examples: The diamond was secured in a platinum bezel setting
He carefully removed the bezel to replace the watch crystal

definitions: piece of cloth or plastic fastened around neck to protect clothing while eating
examples: The baby wore a bib during mealtime to catch spills
She tied a bib around her toddler before serving lunch

definitions: person who compiles bibliographies or studies books as physical objects and their history
examples: The bibliographer spent years cataloging rare manuscripts
She worked as a bibliographer for the university library

definitions: list of books and articles on a particular subject or by a particular author
examples: The thesis included an extensive bibliography of primary sources
Students must cite all references in their bibliography properly

definitions: person who loves and collects books especially rare editions
examples: The bibliophile owned thousands of first edition novels
As a true bibliophile, she spent weekends browsing antiquarian bookshops

definitions: salt containing the anion HCO3 especially sodium bicarbonate used in baking and medicine
examples: She added bicarbonate to the cake batter for leavening
The doctor prescribed bicarbonate for his acid indigestion

definitions: two hundredth anniversary of a significant event celebrated with special ceremonies
examples: The town celebrated its bicentenary with parades and festivities
The bicentenary of the author's birth attracted worldwide attention

definitions: relating to or marking a two hundredth anniversary of an important event
examples: The nation planned elaborate bicentennial celebrations for its founding
Bicentennial coins were minted to commemorate the special occasion

definitions: large muscle in the upper arm that flexes the elbow and rotates the forearm
examples: He flexed his biceps to show his strength training results
The athlete tore her biceps during the weightlifting competition

definitions: petty quarrel or argument about trivial matters between people
examples: Their constant bicker over household chores annoyed everyone
The siblings' bicker could be heard throughout the house

definitions: continuous arguing about petty and trivial matters in an irritating way
examples: The committee accomplished nothing due to constant bickering
Their bickering over minor details delayed the entire project

definitions: activity or sport of riding bicycles for transport exercise or recreation
examples: Bicycling to work helps reduce carbon emissions significantly
She took up bicycling to improve her cardiovascular health

definitions: person who makes an offer of payment especially at an auction
examples: The highest bidder won the antique vase for thousands
Several bidders competed fiercely for the rare painting

definitions: action of offering to pay a particular amount for something at auction
authoritative order or command from someone
examples: The bidding started at one hundred dollars
Excited bidding drove the price higher than expected
She left immediately at his bidding
The servants carried out their master's bidding

definitions: event occurring every two years or lasting for two years
examples: The art exhibition is a biennial showcase of contemporary works
Congress faces biennial elections for House of Representatives members

definitions: movable frame on which a coffin or corpse is placed before burial
examples: Pallbearers carried the bier slowly into the church
Flowers covered the bier during the memorial service

definitions: division of something into two branches or parts forming a fork shape
examples: The river's bifurcation created two separate channels
At the bifurcation, travelers must choose between two paths

definitions: crime of marrying someone while already legally married to another person
examples: He was charged with bigamy after his first wife discovered everything
Bigamy is illegal in most countries around the world

definitions: wild sheep native to North American mountains with large curved horns
examples: The bighorn sheep climbed the steep rocky cliff effortlessly
Photographers waited hours to capture images of the elusive bighorn
